009package imagingbook.pub.hough.lines;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
014import ij.gui.Roi;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines.HessianLine;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents a straight line in Hessian normal form, i.e.,
020 * x * cos(angle) + y * sin(angle) = radius. 
021 */
022public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
023        private final int count;
024        private final double xRef;
025        private final double yRef;
026
027        /**
028         * Public constructor
029         * @param angle the line's normal angle
030         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
031         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
032         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
033         * @param count count
034         */
035        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
036                super(angle, radius);
037                this.xRef = xRef;
038                this.yRef = yRef;
039                this.count = count;
040        }
041        
042        public HoughLine(HessianLine hline, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
043                this(hline.getAngle(), hline.getRadius(), xRef, yRef, count);
044        }
045        
046        public static HoughLine create(Point p1, Point p2, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
047                Point p1r = Point.create(p1.getX() - xRef, p1.getY() - yRef);
048                Point p2r = Point.create(p2.getX() - xRef, p2.getY() - yRef);
049                return new HoughLine(HessianLine.create(p1r, p2r), xRef, yRef, count);
050        }
051        
052        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * @return The accumulator count associated with this line.
056         */
057        public int getCount() {
058                return count;
059        }
060        
061        public double getXref() {
062                return xRef;
063        }
064        
065        public double getYref() {
066                return yRef;
067        }
068        
069        // other methods ------------------------------------------
070        
071        /**
072         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
073         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
074         * (x, y) is located.
075         * 
076         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
077         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
078         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
079         */
080        @Override
081        public double getDistance(double x, double y) {
082                return super.getDistance(x - xRef, y - yRef);
083        }
084        
085//      /**
086//       * This is a brute-force drawing method which simply marks all image pixels that
087//       * are sufficiently close to the HoughLine hl. The drawing color for ip must be
088//       * previously set.
089//       * 
090//       * @param ip        the {@link ImageProcessor} instance to draw to.
091//       * @param thickness the thickness of the lines to be drawn.
092//       */
093//      @Override
094//      public void draw(ImageProcessor ip, double thickness) {
095//              final int w = ip.getWidth();
096//              final int h = ip.getHeight();
097//              final double dmax = 0.5 * thickness;
098//              for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
099//                      for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
100//                              // get the distance between (u,v) and the line hl:
101//                              double d = Math.abs(this.getDistance(u, v));
102//                              if (d <= dmax) {
103//                                      ip.drawPixel(u, v);
104//                              }
105//                      }
106//              }
107//      }
108        
109        /**
110         * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
111         * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
112         * is equivalent to the distance of the reference point (typically the
113         * image center) to the coordinate origin.
114         * @return the new line
115         */
116        public PolygonRoi makeLine() {
117                double length = Math.sqrt(xRef * xRef + yRef * yRef);
118                return this.makeLine(length);
119        }
120        
121        /**
122         * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
123         * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
124         * is measured from its center point (the point closest to the reference
125         * point) in both directions.
126         * 
127         * @param length the length of the line
128         * @return the new line
129         */
130        public PolygonRoi makeLine(double length) {
131                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
132                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
133                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
134                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
135                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
136                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
137                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
138                float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
139                float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
140                float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
141                float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
142                float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
143                float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
144                return new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
145        }
146        
147        /**
148         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
149         * point count.
150         * @param hl2 another {@link HoughLine} instance.
151         */
152        public int compareTo(HoughLine hl2) {
153                HoughLine hl1 = this;
154                if (hl1.count > hl2.count)
155                        return -1;
156                else if (hl1.count < hl2.count)
157                        return 1;
158                else
159                        return 0;
160        }
161        
162        @Override
163        public String toString() {
164                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
165                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
166        }
167        
168        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
169        
170//      public static void main(String[] args) {
171//              Point p1 = Point.create(30, 10);
172//              Point p2 = Point.create(200, 100);
173//              
174//              HoughLine L = HoughLine.create(p1, p2, 90, 60, 0);
175//              System.out.println(L.toString());
176//      }
177        
178        // HoughLine <angle = 2.058, radius = -16.116, xRef = 90.000, yRef = 60.000, count = 0>
179}
